# Discord Channel Analysis: üíª‚îÇdevelopers

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around Hyperfy's development ecosystem, with focus on VRM avatar implementation, agent functionality, and vehicle physics. Users discussed the new documentation location, with maximus providing the updated link to docs.hyperfy.xyz. There was technical discussion about VRM exports in Blender, specifically regarding blendshape limitations across multiple meshes. Ashxn provided clarification on the node client for agents, explaining that it properly runs all systems regular players do, including physics and player controllers, making agents behave almost identically to human players. Valiant shared progress on vehicle implementation, showing videos of smooth flying mechanics. The conversation also touched on the "Stonk Market World" project and the Eliza agent starter repository. Additionally, vox mentioned that v2 now supports screenUV video with streaming, UV scrolling, and agents.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What's the new quickstart/installation link? (asked by emotionull) A: https://docs.hyperfy.xyz/welcome/quickstart/ (answered by maximus)
Q: Anyone been successful in exporting generated VRMs with blendshapes through Blender? (asked by lucii.io) A: Partially answered by Ashxn who indicated Blender VRM should support blendshapes on more than one mesh
Q: Are the avatars in the shared Twitter post VRMs? (asked by jin) A: Yes, they're VRM because they're literally players (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Should I stall working with the eliza agent starter repo? (asked by 0mka) A: No, but note the dev branch has an agent.mjs file showing how to use the true node client (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there a single place/board kept up to date with core functionality for v2? (asked by hiroP) A: The docs folder in the repo is comprehensive but technical, and https://docs.hyperfy.xyz has community knowledge (answered by Ashxn)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: maximus | Helpee: emotionull | Context: Needed updated documentation link | Resolution: Provided the correct docs URL
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: lucii.io | Context: VRM export with blendshapes across multiple meshes | Resolution: Partial - suggested Blender VRM should support multiple meshes
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: 0mka | Context: Questions about agent implementation | Resolution: Explained differences between old and new approaches, directed to agent.mjs in dev branch
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: hiroP | Context: Finding documentation on v2 functionality | Resolution: Pointed to both technical docs in repo and community knowledge base

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Implement VRM export with blendshapes on multiple meshes in Blender | Mentioned By: lucii.io
Technical: Convert GitHub avatar collection to VRM format | Mentioned By: jin
Technical: Complete "Stonk Market World" implementation | Mentioned By: jin
Technical: Improve vehicle landing mechanics | Mentioned By: Valiant
Feature: Vehicle implementation with smooth flying mechanics | Mentioned By: Valiant
Documentation: Update or clarify agent implementation documentation | Mentioned By: 0mka

The chat segment is extremely brief, consisting of only two messages. Maximus shared a link to a Coinbase Developer Platform page about "x402" with an expression of surprise ("Holy moly"). Ashxn responded with a one-word acknowledgment ("crazy"). There is no technical discussion, problem-solving, or implementation details in this exchange.

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. The main technical points include:
- Ashxn mentioned they paused platform development to conduct R&D and have now locked in a direction, moving to execution phase
- Agent12 noted that since the Core is Open-Source, there have been community efforts to make Hyperfy compatible with both Solana ecosystem and EVM
- There was a brief mention of documentation updates with a new docs.hyperfy.xyz link that should replace the old hyperfy.how link
- No specific technical implementations or solutions were discussed in detail
- The conversation included general greetings, health advice about desk work, and brief questions about platform launch timing

## 2. FAQ
Q: When do you plan to launch the platform? (asked by Alexa) A: "I can't give dates but it'll happen out of nowhere like most things we do here... we paused on the platform to do some RND and make sure we were going in the absolute best direction. That direction is now locked in so it's execution time." (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Curious if the platform will be Solana or multi-chain (asked by nettuser) A: "Since the Core is Open-Source there has been community efforts towards making Hyperfy usable for BOTH Solana ecosystem and EVM Compatibility." (answered by Agent12)
Q: No ai? (asked by johan) A: "It's literally in the pic haha. ai are like humans. we want them playing games and teaching people etc in every world." (answered by Ashxn)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Community | Context: Outdated documentation link | Resolution: Suggested replacing old hyperfy.how link with new docs.hyperfy.xyz in the link section
Helper: vox | Helpee: Community | Context: Health issues from desk work | Resolution: Shared personal experience with back pain and provided advice on taking breaks and exercises

## 4. Action Items
Type: Documentation | Description: Replace old hyperfy.how link with new docs.hyperfy.xyz in the link section | Mentioned By: Gert-Jan Akerboom
Type: Technical | Description: Continue execution on platform development after R&D phase | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Type: Technical | Description: Support for both Solana ecosystem and EVM compatibility | Mentioned By: Agent12

# Analysis of üßä‚îÇ3d-design Channel

## 1. Summary:
The conversation centers around Hyperfy's transition from v1 to v2 platform. A user (carlosmu) inquires about creating a new world in Hyperfy v1, but learns that v1 world NFTs are no longer available as the platform is transitioning to v2. Ashxn explains that while v1 is in maintenance mode and still functional, no major updates are planned. For v2, users can self-host the open-source world engine, use a hosting service like hyperworld.host, build locally, or use play.hyperfy.xyz where everyone has build permissions. The documentation has moved from hyperfy.how to docs.hyperfy.xyz, and a roadmap for v2 is forthcoming.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Can I create a new world/land in Hyperfy v1? (asked by carlosmu) A: The v1 world NFTs are no longer available as Hyperfy is transitioning to a new v2 engine and platform. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can I buy a world in opensea? (asked by carlosmu) A: Yes, but the v1 platform is in maintenance mode with no more major updates, though it still works. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there any chance to try the v2 builder? (asked by carlosmu) A: Yes, the v2 world engine is open source and can be self-hosted or used via a hosting service like hyperworld.host. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can we build locally? (asked by carlosmu) A: Absolutely. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is this the right link for v2 docs? (asked by carlosmu) A: The docs moved to https://docs.hyperfy.xyz. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is play.hyperfy.xyz v1 or v2 infrastructure? (asked by carlosmu) A: v2. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there a roadmap for the release of v2? (asked by carlosmu) A: Roadmap coming soon! (answered by Ashxn)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: carlosmu | Context: User wanted to create a new world in Hyperfy but was unaware of v1 to v2 transition | Resolution: Explained current status and provided alternative options including self-hosting, using hyperworld.host, or building in play.hyperfy.xyz
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: carlosmu | Context: User needed documentation for v2 | Resolution: Provided updated documentation link (docs.hyperfy.xyz) and mentioned play.hyperfy.xyz where everyone has build permissions

## 4. Action Items:
Documentation: Check updated v2 documentation at docs.hyperfy.xyz | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Technical: Try building in play.hyperfy.xyz where everyone has build permissions | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Technical: Consider self-hosting the v2 world engine or using hyperworld.host | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Feature: Wait for upcoming v2 roadmap | Mentioned By: Ashxn

No technical discussions, decisions, or problem-solving occurred in this chat segment. The only message was from user Rick sharing a tweet about a "WIP Meetup" that had taken place, with a reference to pictures shared under a video. The message was purely informational and social in nature, without any technical content to analyze.

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat in the "üêû‚îÇissues" channel addressed two main technical issues. First, Gert-Jan Akerboom reported difficulty accessing the "play world," which ash investigated and potentially reset, resolving the access problem. Second, Gert-Jan encountered a behavior where adding multiple NEON apps to a world caused all apps to revert to the default color when using the "unique" setting. Ash explained that "unique apps" refers to unique settings while meshes are still instanced behind the scenes, causing them to share materials. Ash provided a solution by suggesting setting `mesh.linked=false` to unlink meshes, though noting this would decrease performance at scale.

## 2. FAQ
Q: When adding multiple NEON apps to a world, why doesn't the color setting persist with the 'unique' setting? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: The "unique apps" setting only creates unique settings while meshes are still instanced behind the scenes, causing them to share materials. You can unlink meshes with mesh.linked=false, but this decreases performance at scale. (answered by ash)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: ash | Helpee: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Context: Unable to access the "play world" | Resolution: Ash investigated and possibly reset something, which resolved the access issue
Helper: ash | Helpee: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Context: Multiple NEON apps in a world sharing the same color despite "unique" setting | Resolution: Explained that meshes are instanced and suggested using mesh.linked=false to unlink them

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Investigate and fix the "play world" access issue | Description: Users unable to access the play world environment | Mentioned By: Gert-Jan Akerboom
Technical: Consider improving how the "unique" setting works with material properties | Description: Currently multiple NEON apps share materials even with "unique" setting | Mentioned By: Gert-Jan Akerboom
Documentation: Document the limitations of the "unique" setting for apps and explain the mesh.linked property | Description: Users need to understand how instancing affects material properties | Mentioned By: ash
